com.palomamobile.android.sdk.media

Interface IMediaManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IServiceManager<IMediaService>

    public interface IMediaManager
extends IServiceManager<IMediaService>
    This interface provides convenient job creation methods that provide easy access to the underlying IMediaService functionality. App developers can either use BaseRetryPolicyAwareJob job instances returned by the createJob...() methods, or create custom jobs that invoke methods of the IMediaService returned by IServiceManager.getService()
    To get a concrete implementation of this interface call ServiceSupport.Instance.getServiceManager(IMediaManager.class)

    • Method Detail

      • createJobMediaUploadPublic

        JobUploadMediaPublic createJobMediaUploadPublic(String mime,
                                              String filePath)
        Create a new JobUploadMediaPublic.
        Parameters:
        mime - mime type describing the media content eg: "text/html; charset=UTF-8", charset is optional
        filePath - local path to the file with media content
        Returns:
        new job instance

      • createJobMediaUploadPrivate

        JobUploadMediaPrivate createJobMediaUploadPrivate(String mime,
                                                String filePath)
        Create a new JobUploadMediaPrivate.
        Parameters:

        filePath - local path to the file with media content

      • requestExpiringPublicUrl

        Uri requestExpiringPublicUrl(Uri mediaUrl)
                             throws IOException
        User may wish to share private media that was created using JobUploadMediaPrivate or directly via a call to IMediaService.postMediaPrivate(String, long, TypedInput). Access to such media requires authentication. This method returns a short-lived publicly accessible Url that can be shared.
        Parameters:
        mediaUrl - url of a media resource
        Returns:
        short-lived publicly accessible Url if media resource located at mediaUrl is a private, unmodified mediaUrl otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException
